page.title: 11POULTRY FARM
page.content: ASHCLOSE POULTRY FARM{ { @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@} Mr and Mrs Cockayne began this farm about{4}years ago.They keep between 32,000 and{33000}hens.The hens come to the farm at{18}weeks old and lay until they are{18}months old.There are{2 kinds of hens - Hisex and Shavers,{5} hens are kept in}each cage.On the side of the cage is a red button.The hen is tempted to peck it to get water.They are fed{3}times a day.Eggs are collected every day, usually{80}boxes holding approximately{30}dozen.{1}hen lays about{300}eggs a year.All these hens lay brown eggs.{5}employees grade the eggs according to size.Then they are sent to restaurants,hotels and shops in Nottingham.Cracked or reject eggs are sent to bakeries.Recently animal rights protesters burned a tractor at Ashclose Farm.
